citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Food receptacles are not being cleaned and sanitized appropriately. Located within three feeders along the top upper rim
was old feed that had been wet and allowed to decay. Feed had become compacted and encased with mold. Within the
feeders located beneath the fresh food was a layer of white and gray powdery organic material and a black greasy
substance. Present above and around the feed receptacles were minor amounts of cob webs and grime. One feeder had
approximately day old feces within the food and a dog was seen eating the kibble around it. Improper cleaning of feed
receptacles can make food unpalatable and decrease it nutritive value. Food and water receptacle must be sanitized at
least once every 2 weeks and more often if necessary to prevent accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and
other disease hazards.
Correct by 7/11/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
COURTNEY JERNIGAN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Food receptacles are not being cleaned and sanitized appropriately. Located within three feeders along the top upper rim 
was old feed that had been wet and allowed to decay. Feed had become compacted and encased with mold. Within the 
feeders located beneath the fresh food was a layer of white and gray powdery organic material and a black greasy 
substance. Present above and around the feed receptacles were minor amounts of cob webs and grime. One feeder had 
approximately day old feces within the food and a dog was seen eating the kibble around it. Improper cleaning of feed 
receptacles can make food unpalatable and decrease it nutritive value. Food and water receptacle must be sanitized at 
least once every 2 weeks and more often if necessary to prevent accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and 
other disease hazards. 
Correct by 7/11/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
COURTNEY JERNIGAN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
